t: Song of Solomon 5
He
I*pn came to my garden, my sister, my bride, I*ld gathered my myrrh with my spice, I*ld ate my honeycomb with my honey, I*ld drank my wine with my milk.
Others
Eat,*pn friends, drink, and*ld be drunk with love!
The Bride Searches for Her Beloved
She

I*pn slept, but my heart was awake. A*ln sound! My beloved is knocking. “Open*ln to me, my sister, my love, my*ld dove, my perfect one, for*ln my head is wet with dew, my*ld locks with the drops of the night.”
I*ln had put off my garment; how*ld could I put it on? I*ln had bathed my feet; how*ld could I soil them?
My*ln beloved put his hand to the latch, and*ld my heart was thrilled within me.
I*ln arose to open to my beloved, and*ld my hands dripped with myrrh, my*ln fingers with liquid myrrh, on*ld the handles of the bolt.
I*ln opened to my beloved, but*ld my beloved had turned and gone. My*ln soul failed me when he spoke. I*ln sought him, but found him not; I*ld called him, but he gave no answer.
The*ln watchmen found me as*ld they went about in the city; they*ln beat me, they bruised me, they*ld took away my veil, those*ld watchmen of the walls.
I*ln adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if*ld you find my beloved, that*ln you tell him I*ld am sick with love.
Others
What*pn is your beloved more than another beloved, O*ld most beautiful among women? What*ln is your beloved more than another beloved, that*ld you thus adjure us?
The Bride Praises Her Beloved
She
My*pn beloved is radiant and ruddy, distinguished*ld among ten thousand.
His*ln head is the finest gold; his*ld locks are wavy, black*ld as a raven.
His*ln eyes are like doves beside*ld streams of water, bathed*ln in milk, sitting*ld beside a full pool.
His*ln cheeks are like beds of spices, mounds*ld of sweet-smelling herbs. His*ln lips are lilies, dripping*ld liquid myrrh.
His*ln arms are rods of gold, set*ld with jewels. His*ln body is polished ivory, bedecked*ld with sapphires.
His*ln legs are alabaster columns, set*ld on bases of gold. His*ln appearance is like Lebanon, choice*ld as the cedars.
His*ln mouth is most sweet, and*ld he is altogether desirable. This*ln is my beloved and this is my friend, O*ld daughters of Jerusalem.
